Pontifical Bolivarian University: The Pontifical Bolivarian University (Spanish: Universidad Pontificia Bolivariana), also referred to as UPB, is a private university in Colombia with its main campus in Medellín, where it was founded in 1936. As of 2023, the university is ranked among the top four universities in Colombia and among the top 30 universities in Latin America by QS World University Rankings.[1] In addition to its main campus in Medellin, the university has campuses in  Bogotá, Bucaramanga, Montería and Palmira. As of 2021, the university had an estimated 26,000 students.[2]
